keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campiagned for Remain in 2016. Worked cross-Party to find a solution in Parliament. Proposed Indicative Votes in early 2019. Led calls in Parliament for a ‘Confirmatory Vote’. Put a Deal vs Remain to a public vote 3-6 months after the election. Only Labour promises a further vote.
Championed greater investment in our NHS and more spend in Mental Health.
Spoken on the Climate Emergency, organised an air quality summit and co-signatory to Bill on single use plastics.
Spoken out against cuts to no. of Police officers.
Campaigned against the school cuts and cuts to public services.

mentions.candidate: Committed to and will only ever represent THIS constituency. NOT a career politician.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Johnson’s hard Brexit candidate only needs a 1.2% swing. The Conservative candidate has been parachuted-in moving here recently. He was a Councillor in Windsor and remained until a few months ago (May 2019). Candidate in Ashton-under-Lyne in 2017. He's a hard Brexiteer.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Only two parties can win here in 2019. The LibDems would need an 800% increase in vote. Such a large swing has never occurred in the past 50 years of General Elections.

issues.brexitEurope: Campiagned for Remain in 2016. Worked cross-Party to find a solution in Parliament. Proposed Indicative Votes in early 2019. Led calls in Parliament for a ‘Confirmatory Vote’. Put a Deal vs Remain to a public vote 3-6 months after the election. Only Labour promises a further vote.

personalStories.story: Lived in Warwick and Leamington for 15 years. Family ties in education and healthcare.

examples: The LibDems would need an 800% increase in vote.
Johnson’s hard Brexit candidate only needs a 1.2% swing. Any votes away from me will only enable a hard Brexit.
Johnson’s hard Brexit candidate only needs a 1.2% swing.

The Conservative candidate has been parachuted-in moving here recently. He was a Councillor in Windsor and remained until a few months ago (May 2019). Candidate in Ashton-under-Lyne in 2017. He's a hard Brexiteer.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: Lived in Warwick and Leamington for 15 years.
nonPolicyAttributes.employment: 24 years in industry (Peugeot) in UK and France.
nonPolicyAttributes.education: My wife works at Warwick University.
nonPolicyAttributes.family: My older step-son works at Warwick Hospital.
